greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of all terms of triangle of absolute differences of the divisors of n.
comment: Note that if n is prime then a(n) = n - 1.
example: a(10) = 13 because the divisors of 10 are 1, 2, 5, 10; the triangle of absolute differences is
and the sum of the terms of triangle is 1+3+5+2+2+0 = 13.
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Aug 04 2011
